website_summaries.verdict: The Audio-Technica LP120-USB is solid, low-cost turntable for anyone looking for an easy entry point into the world of vinyl records.
pros: The Audio-Technica LP120-USB has a built-in preamp with bypass control, a USB port for digitizing records, a quiet motor, a solid build structure and a bunch of useful accessories
cons: Long-term users may run into trouble replacing the hard-wired RCA connections

customer_reviews.title: Motor noise makes this turntable unlistenable.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this turntable for about 2 months, dramatic improvement in sound quality and tracking (no more skipping) over the LP-60 I had tolerated for years. But after 3 months a nonstop motor pulsation noise showed up and has gotten progressively louder ever since. Tried replacing the stock platter with several different cork and thick rubber sound-dampening mats, but the motor noise persists. I can't listen to anything with quiet passages or the noise is infuriating. Unfortunately I'm outside Amazon's return window so I'm stuck with this piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Warped platter.
customer_reviews.text: It either works or it doesn't, right? And mine has great tone, heavy duty build quality, sounds great except: the platter's warped. The record goes up and down every rotation. I'm using this to digitize old albums and you can hear the steady, clockwork up-n-down all through the project file. Totally useless as far as I'm concerned. After I hit 'submit' on this I'm contacting Audio Technica to see how easy it is to get a flat platter.
customer_reviews.author: BelD

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t have auto return when it’s finished playing...!
customer_reviews.text: They thought they had everything anybody would want in a turntable. A lot of bells and whistles, yes. Wow, it has the capability of reversing the song. I’ll use that maybe when someone asks me to try it. But it doesn’t have auto return when the record is finished. So you have to get up from where you are sitting every 30 minutes or so to stop the thud of the inner groove. Every turntable I have ever owned, at least, had the record stop and the stylus return. (Except my plastic GE record player I had when I was 5) I cannot believe that function is not included...
customer_reviews.author: JCR

customer_reviews.title: there is a time bomb inside it that renders it useless through no fault of the user
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2015 and have used it exactly three times since. As of today, March 7, 2018, the turntable won't turn. I've discovered this is a VERY common problem with this device and requires a replacement of a fuse that is soldered onto the PCB inside the body of the unit. If you buy this turntable, just know that while it may be well-priced, there is a time bomb inside it that renders it useless through no fault of the user.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Manning

customer_reviews.title: Not for Classical Records
customer_reviews.text: Warning! If you are going to listen to anything that has very quiet parts of the record, do not get this player. Due to the poor design of the pre-amp it drops out audio on very quiet parts of music entirely. I was attempting to use in order to digitize some classical vinyl records, but the only way to do that with this record player is to take it apart and bypass the pre-amp. I would have given it 1 star, but I think if I was only listening to rock/pop/non-classical it would be just fine. It operates well and setup was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Finally a great turntable at a fantastic price
customer_reviews.text: Finally a great turntable at a fantastic price. I looked online for quite awhile trying to decide which turntable to get to re-introduce myself to vinyl. I didn't want to spend anything near $500 for a turntable until I was sure I would listen often enough to validate the purchase price. I'm glad I went this route, If I get serious enough about vinyl, I can "upgrade" this tt with a better cartridge and pre-amp. Out of the box, it already sounds great. The build quality is excellent and nothing really feels cheap or poorly executed with this turntable. If you are on a budget, look no further than this one.
customer_reviews.author: JonD

customer_reviews.title: Motor noise
customer_reviews.text: I'll come right to the point; the AT-LP120 I received has a clearly audible, and totally unacceptable level of motor noise. Even standing four feet away from the turntable the noise can be clearly heard. After searching the Internet I've found that others have the same problem with their AT-LP120s. Thus I must conclude that the problem with my turntable is not unique. Such noise, IMO, renders the AT-LP120 unsuitable for anything resembling quality listening experience. IMO the AT-LP120 is only suitable for use a a DJ device where any noise produced by the turntable would be irrelevant.
customer_reviews.author: Don  B.

customer_reviews.title: Motor wont spin. Has had very little use. ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to update my review. After contacting Audio-Technica and letting them know how dissatisfied I was about my 4yr old AT-LP120-USB breaking without even being used, Audio-Technica made things right. They told me to send it in and that they would repair it for free (they replaced the play/stop button) and send it back to me.
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this since November of 2017. I am very pleased with it. The only complaint I have, but I leave 5 stars, because it's my fault for not doing enough research upfront, and the merchant is clear as to what they offer, is that when the record stops... the arm doesn't go up automatically, so you must lift it up manually. Additionally, they have a placement for the felt/round cleaning attachment, but I am yet to find it with the merchant. I wish that was included. Just nit-picky two things, otherwise, this is perfect! Best value, based on my research of several hours and numerous blogs, I could find.
customer_reviews.author: Elvijs-Kristians

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up using a video I found online about balancing the arm. Sounds amazing with the Edifier R1280DB speakers. I was worried about turntable wobble after seeing a couple reviews and buying a cheap one a few years ago, but this one doesn't wobble at all and there are no pitch variations. This player is heavy, so I gave the portability 3 stars -- but there aren't a lot of wires and the arm locks into place, so if you wanted to move this around the house on occasion it wouldn't be a pain, but this isn't something you'd take with you to the coffee shop unless your a super hipster.
customer_reviews.author: versak

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and quality, wish there was an auto return feature
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sounding record player and has a host of features I think set it above the pack in its price range. *Adjustable rubber feet to account for non level surfaces. *Direct drive that stops and starts records immediately. *A light the helps you see the correct groove for accurate song selection. *Variable pitch adjuster *Optional on board phono amplifier to use powered and unpowered speakers One option I wish it had was an auto-return feature.
customer_reviews.author: Zampcaster

customer_reviews.title: Read the negative reviews also.
customer_reviews.text: Direct drive motor noise is a known defect in this turntable. I failed to read the negative reviews of this product, both on Amazon and on other online sources before ordering. Yesterday I unpacked it, set it up following the instructions, and as soon as I started the turntable I could hear the sound coming from the turntable motor. I went online and found numerous complaints about it. If you are not a serious audiophile, and mostly listen to music that does not contain very quiet passages, you will probably be okay with this unit. If you are extremely picky, you should consider another product and save yourself some trouble.
customer_reviews.author: D. B.

customer_reviews.title: Phono hum
customer_reviews.text: Good motor drive and tone arm. Low rumble and good speed control. Works well if you use the internal pre-amp and/or the USB output. Do NOT buy this model if you want to use the phono cartridge direct to an external pre-amp, you will have hum issues. I was told the "X" version fixed this problem. i rewired my unit. I no longer have the internal pre-amp/USB function but I have a properly wired and grounded phono out with no hum. Works great now!
customer_reviews.author: B. Kleven

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working Within a Year (When Warranty Runs Out)
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this player in 2013. It worked for a while, maybe 6 months, then the table wouldn't turn. It would only turn about half the time. Now, it doesn't even turn at all. I should have left a bad review much sooner because I haven't been able to use it for about 3-4 years now. I would suggest buying another player.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: You Don't Need To Be A Pro DJ or An Audiophile to LOVE this Table!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying this. If you're searching for a good middle-of-the-road starter Table, this is it. I have never owned a professional turntable, but this is leagues above those Crosley's and all-in-one's you can get at department stores. This is an Audiophile-worthy table, for sure. Has all the features you'll need, totally manual. Sounds great with the included AT-95E Cart, and despite the VERY short hardwired RCA ouput cables, this is a stellar and wonderfully designed table! Sounds great, looks great, and it's under $300! Couldn't get no better than that! This also makes great recordings of your records if you're into that!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cook

customer_reviews.title: Anti skate is not accurate at all !!!
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with ability to change out Cartridges and adjust the counterweight and anti skate .. but the anti skate adjustment is way off!!! I had a JVC turntable in the 80's and had similar features but the anti skate was dead on compared to the Audio Technica. I still like it but Audio Technica should test their products before they sell them. If this is a product from Japan,it falls very short compared to their reputation of quality control in manufacturing!! Audio Technica should have a purchase satisfaction card after you use it to see if everything is as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Reyes

customer_reviews.title: my new lover
customer_reviews.text: I'm an audiophile, I used to have a Pro Ject high end turntable hooked up to Mcintosh amp. I don't have that kind of money anymore but whatever. My point is that I like this turntable better than the super expensive, fragile ones. This one feels good, the sound is more than expected, it's just a smooth, good af turntable. I have it hooked up to a JBL powered speaker and it sounds so good and warm, certainly better than it should. Now i'm just waiting for the Prince 1999 10 Vinyl box.
customer_reviews.author: SFNico

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: What a huge difference this made compared to my 26 y.o. turntable which was pretty good with a new cartridge. The sound from this unit is so much better. My wife who is a natural skeptic was impressed. Well packed, good directions and easy to use. Plus one of the other reviewers gave the specs for the cartridge that comes with it to set the skate and tracking force. (2.5 and 2.0) which saved the hassle of looking it up. Love Amazon reviewers!
customer_reviews.author: PeteF

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: great turn table, solid, easy to set up and it sounds great. Customer service is also great, I had an issue where one speaker was fading out, emailed them and in less than a day they shared a detailed response of how to remedy the situation, which turned out to be an easy fix. For those who are unsure if it's worth the money to get a turntable when you can stream music for cheaply, I'd say the experience of putting on an album and listening all the way through has been worth the money. There's also a definite improvement in the warmth of the sound that you don't have to be a complete audio snob to notice.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: still playing records?
customer_reviews.text: After about 30 yrs, my old Dual turntable finally stopped working, I was apprehensive about changing brands until I started using this Audio-Technica, I am not a professional, but feel like one when playing records now. It is easy to use and sounds terrific. This is a great combination of new technology and old sound. It is solidly built and works very smoothly. I recordt also has the versatility of playing 45 and 78 RPM records, so my entire collection is covered.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, has a balanced arm, and has cartridge/stylus and preamp upgrade paths
customer_reviews.text: A great record player for the price point, and so far, very pleased. Sounds *way* better than the cheap players, and I have a lot more trust that my records aren't being damaged by the excessive forces that those players put on the stylus. It also is quite upgradeable for when you want a better cartridge and pre-amp. A note on the preamp, which is a popular negative to discuss: The preamp is descent, but does sound a little muddy to me, and does have some very quiet hum during the quiet spots between tracks; however you *can* bypass the built-in pre-amp via the Phono Outputs, and use your own preamp.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This turntable is the perfect buy/gift for all levels of vinyl lovers - beginners to experienced collectors. With bluetooth capabilities, you're able to connect to modern technology like soundbars, wireless speakers and remote receivers. If the looks alone dont get you to click buy, you can rest assured that Audio-Technica built a quality piece of equipment here. The turntable can self adjust to 'warped', older vinyl producing a smooth tone for some of your older records. I bought one and loved it so much I gifted it to my dad the following Christmas. We now share records and have a blast comparing music tastes. 10/10 would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Two year lifespan, then a cool-looking paperweight
customer_reviews.text: Was fine for two years. Sonics aren't anything to write home about, but I liked the functionality and feature set. Now, after almost exactly two years of light use since purchase, it's suddenly stopped working. Power comes on, but the Start/Stop button does nothing (when it used to elicit a loud, tactile click when pressed, now it's just a dead button). So the table is rendered useless. I haven't investigated a repair, but based on other reviews, it's probably not worth it. I'll just buy a more reputable audiophile brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Posly

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, You won't be disapponted!
customer_reviews.text: I love this turntable, it has all the bells and whistles! When I receive mine I put it in my dedicated stand and level it with rubber shims, then I aligned the stylus with the gage that I bought from amazon, then I adjusted the force on the stylus using a dedicated Neoteck micro scale for 2 grams, and it was like a miracle! I use the Klipsch R-15M powered speaker, and Subwoofer 10 to listen to my records, that finally came to life! The cartridge that comes with it is excellent, and I also love the quartz controlled pitching, I also love the manual pitching adjustment lever. Buy it, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio C. Dasilva

customer_reviews.title: Great Turntable
customer_reviews.text: If you love vinyl this is the turntable for you. Completely manual, you have to place the tone arm on the record and return it to its resting place, so I would not recommend it for beginners. Plays forward and reverse. AND 78's! Yes, I'm 68 years old and still have 78's and have a wonderful collection of vinyl from the 60's and 70's. I have kept my records in great condition. They all play great on this turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S.

customer_reviews.title: It is what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about this purchase. However, when searching reviews all over the net for a good and affordable record player this one kept coming up. When it arrived it was so beautiful to me! I googled how to set up the tone arm and balance it. It wasn’t difficult. I have this hooked up to a little speaker and the sound quality is great. On my list are a nice set of speakers one day for it. I had a turntable as a little girl and only just recently got back into vinyl. I do recommend this one if you are new or old to vinyl.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Stormy MeadowsTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: I like the looks of it
customer_reviews.text: It arrived well packaged, on time. I like the looks of it. It feels smooth and solid. It has all the operating features that I know how to use, and the setup instructions are, well, adequate. The sound is as good as my old-man ears can hear. At first, there was a problem with the left channel dropping out, but after some fumbling around, I re-seated the cartridge, and operation has been perfect since. I'm creating a digital archive of my wife's old vinyl. With a couple of dozen albums done, I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Hoselton

customer_reviews.title: Setup was straight forward and it plays the records well and they sound fine. However
customer_reviews.text: It's a professional looking turntable, very reminiscent of the turntable it was modeled after. Setup was straight forward and it plays the records well and they sound fine. However, the motor can be heard as a "cogging" low level thump, thump, thump as the platter spins. Apparently this is a known issue with some of these turntables. I have a 40+ year old direct drive Kenwood turntable. It's completely silent.
customer_reviews.author: Bluffdad

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at the price point.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first turntable so I wasn't exactly sure what to expect. I've had it for about 3 months now and I play it daily. Hookup was simple and balancing the tonearm was relatively easy, just follow the instructions closely. Currently, no complaints here at all. I would highly recommend this turn table for anyone looking to enter the work of vinyl. For the price, this turntable feels sturdy and of high quality as I would expect. Just remember, you need to buy speakers as well. I actually upgraded the cartridge to a Nagaoka MP-110, I would recommend this as well.
customer_reviews.author: Thuan Vu

customer_reviews.title: Good sound.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an ancient turntable whose cover was broken. This turntable is quite an upgrade from what I had before. Easy to assemble and set up. Works well and sounds great. Doesn't lose its place when the occasional cat walks over it while playing -- which is why I needed a turntable with a cover. It's so nice to listen to my old music again without losing the warmth of the sound as happens with the digital versions. I've even purchased some "new" vinyl to add to my collection.
customer_reviews.author: joe aubuchon

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: The turntable stopped functioning after four months and has to go back to Audio-Technica for repair. I'm glad I'm under warranty but this calls into question their quality control. If I had to do it again I would buy from a different company and maybe spend a bit more money I don't trust this company quality control at all. To their credit, they're willing to take the turntable back and repair or replace it. my advice is to spend your money a bit more wisely and go for a slightly better higher quality product from a different manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Ofria

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful record player. It is a bit more complicated than the cheap players you get from a box store, but it doesn’t take that much understanding. The quality is fantastic! Beautiful sound and the player itself is something to show off at home. My old cheapo player would throw the needle on certain heavier vinyl, scratching them and also just not able to play them. This record has an adjustable weight, so you never have to worry about you needle operating correctly. Many other nice features.
customer_reviews.author: Mel006

customer_reviews.title: Perfect turntable for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying a turntable because I inherited a pristine collection of 1920’s 78’s in addition to some random 33”s. Audio Techica support walked me through getting the system I wanted, knowing what stylus/headshells to use, and how to take care of all of my products!!! Their support is quick and amazing. I can’t say enough amazing things about them and their products.
customer_reviews.author: D.V.

customer_reviews.title: Great for digitizing albums. Does 33 1/3, 45 and 78.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item. Plenty of control to make adjustments everywhere from speed to tone arm pressure. One thing to note. When the tone arm is in resting position the lever won't lift it up. It only keeps the tone arm up when over the platter. Threw me off a bit at first until I realized that. Also you should download the Audacity software directly from the site. The disc has an old version. I also recommend you change the software to listen to the disc as it records (it is in the help section) Works great for digitizing albums. Better than anything I have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Wito

customer_reviews.title: Motor Rumble is the Downfall
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed my ATLP120USB. It is a nice, simple, easy to set up and operate turntable. The sound is excellent, especially after upgrading the Cartridge to the Ortofon 2m Red. Unfortunately, the motor rumble is pronounced between tracks and during quiet moments of the recording. This has been stated and repeated many times through previous reviews. I can only echo those evaluations. The pervasive hum detracts from what would otherwise be a five-star player. Eventually, I grew weary of the rumble and purchased an Audio Technica AT-LP1240-USB XP. It is twice the price but is a dead quiet turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Record Player to support my SONOS sound system (no amplifier required)
customer_reviews.text: I love this record player. It has all the hookups to connect directly to my SONOS sound system allowing me to play my favorite old 70's LP's thought out the house. Or if my wife dictates in the room I'm in only. The sound is great, the tone arm lift and drop is great since it allows me to put the needle to the record softly and accurately. It is super easy to set up and use. For me this is the perfect set up. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Samples

customer_reviews.title: Audio Technica AT-LP120BK-USB Turntable
customer_reviews.text: Returned it as the platter is warped and there is excessive motor noise. After doing research and reading numerous issues with this I opted for a refund. I then ordered a Fluance RT-83 which was a little more expensive but comes with a much better stylus. The Fluance doesn't have the 'bells and whistles' of the Audio Technica AT-LP120BK-USB Turntable but I don't need them.
customer_reviews.author: Hedley W. Davies

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This record player is great for someone who has been rocking a $100 turntable and is ready for an upgrade. I was amazed at how good this player sounds it has perfect sound transfer through my receiver and speakers it’s as good as listening to a cd! I wouldn’t suggest it to a person just starting out because of the investment required and the price of vinyls in general, I collected for several years before I decided on this and I had already spent well over 1k on my record collection.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a family member, but I was the one that assembled it and tested it. Take your time unboxing it and follow the instructions. When I finally got it out of the box and in full view, I was astounded at how beautiful it was. I bought the black one. The finish on this thing is gorgeous! I tested it after careful setup on a 50 year-old album and I heard details I never heard as a kid. I could not imagine spending more money and actually getting anything better than this. In every way, it looks like a precision instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great high end record player!
customer_reviews.text: This player is not for beginners, but if you’re looking for a fantastic, price-conscious option, this is it! The counterweight and anti skate are easy to adjust, and the cartridge head is well built (typically you see a lot of plastic on this part, but AT did not cheap out) The TT comes with a number of fun fiddly bits, like reverse playing and a really satisfying speed control. The strobe light is great to have, and it even comes with a track light to help you place the needle!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and incredible value. Just make sure you set it up right!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazingly good turntable for the price. I highly recommend it. I use it every single day. READ THE MANUAL BEFORE USING IT AND MAKE ALL THE ADJUSTMENTS!! If you ship this, it may not work right, not because of it being broken but because you didn’t set it up right. When I got mine, the balance weight was not set right for pressure and I thought it was broken because sound was coming from one channel only! They’re not clear in the manual, so if it’s a little wonky, there are a to. If videos on YouTube showing you how to properly set it up!
customer_reviews.author: M.J. Hullett

customer_reviews.title: The strobe patterns on the side of the turntable allow you to very that your spinning speed is absolutely perfect. Even the built-in amp sounds good if you ...
customer_reviews.text: This turntable has met and exceeded my every expectation so far. Design and build is well thought out and solid feeling. The strobe patterns on the side of the turntable allow you to very that your spinning speed is absolutely perfect. Even the built-in amp sounds good if you don't have a receiver with preamp connections. No regrets whatsoever. I'm as happy as can be with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome turntable
customer_reviews.text: This turntable is awesome,it may be a little pricey but remember you get what you pay for. Setup is easy,even if you are all thumbs,so you’ll be enjoying your recordsbwfore you know it. The felt mat that comes with it is so so ok,I’d recommend upgrading to a cork mat like I did after watching Vinyl Eyezz on YouTube for upgrades to this turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Burma

customer_reviews.title: Stunning quality turntable
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to rip my albums to store on my hard drives. I had not listened to my albums in many years and collected vast quantities of music via mp3 over any years. On listening to the quality from this turntable and my specialist amp and speakers, I decided it was a waste of time to rip the albums into inferior quality to put on some overfilled TB hard drive which I will never listen to. And it's more fun to play an album anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Got Vinyl? Go no further...
customer_reviews.text: I have been collecting music is all available formats since 1968. Having a substantial number of titles on vinyl, I needed to find a turntable that delivered the quality I have with the rest of my entertainment system. Audio Technica system really hit it point of the park in that respect. First off, it is remarkable heavy; it’s not a cheap rattletrap “entry model’ turntable. The constructions of the body is the simple definition of what it necessary to get everything out of a vinyl record. If I had this in 1985 when CD’s made their show, I would have stuck to my guns and doubled down on LP’s.
customer_reviews.author: H. J. King

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So far this record player is great! The box was a little beaten up, however the record player appears to be fine. If you do not have a receiver with a phono in or if your receiver is more than 3 feet away from the record player you will need to buy an adapter. The adapter cannot be found in store, you need to order it from Amazon. So I had to wait a few days to listen to my records. But measure your distances (mine was about 5 feet away) and I order the RCA Stereo Audio Cable that had male to female ends. After getting that cable, we can listen to the amazing sounds of vinyl.
customer_reviews.author: BoyMom101

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable performance
customer_reviews.text: Product packaging is horrible. My package arrived in the Audio Technica box that was opened, packaging styrofoam was visible and the box was torn with styrofoam sticking out. I took pictures of the box on my porch and decided to check it out. To my amazement the turntable works, and after initial setup and tonearm balancing the performance is acceptable. The anti skate gave me a little difficulty, however I reset the the tonearm balance to overcome the issues.
customer_reviews.author: Duncant

customer_reviews.title: Great turntable.
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a really nice turntable. It is easy to set up, if you have any av skills you should have no trouble setting it up. The instructions give you all the info you need to get it up and running and how to "fine tune" the turntable. The sound thru my receiver is quite good, again an easy hook-up. I would recommend this turntable to anyone who wants great sound and ease off use.
customer_reviews.author: sammy125

customer_reviews.title: The sound keeps cutting out
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a 1990s RCA record player to Audio-Technica. The sound was an incredible upgrade & was also very impressed with design & style. Its the centerpiece of the den. My complaint is the sound will cut out at an almost a 70% decrease. I have to tap the top of the case for the sound to come back. My son's friend didn't know this and increased the volume. He bumped the case accidentally & the sound was so extremely loud that everyone in the room jumped! I retuned this to Amazon & exchanged for the same model. Its still having the same issue - I guess I have to leave a note on the volume control.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Affordable/Proven Quality/Adaptable
customer_reviews.text: I have an older version of this same turntable. After 20 years, my old version didn't function correctly. Without excessive words, I have experiance with A/T products. They are solid and priced well. RCA & USB out. (Recording software included if you want to transfer LPs to CDs). I was already familiar with the unit so putting the few items together took all of 10 minutes (including unpacking). BTW, VERY well packaged. Enough said. Buy it if you're in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Ken D.  West Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to love vinyl again...
customer_reviews.text: Just getting into vinyl. All sources kept leading me to this record player. Most of my decision was around the drive system. This Audio Technica has a direct drive instead of the belt drive. I wasn’t sure if I wanted to deal with the potential complexities of belt drive. I also like the idea that I can change the speed of play (thanks Beatles) if need be. Highly recommend this player. It’s very easy to set up. I’m not a serious audiophile.....yet...but I love that I can start listening to vinyl and appreciate some of the nuances. It’s a great hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Mack

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly, Sounds Great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a good while ago for myself as a Christmas present. c: I had an old Crosley and the quality just wasn’t there. I had sent it in three times because it was playing too fast and when you know a song in and out no matter how little it’s moving, fast or slow, you can tell. I hadn’t realized I needed to buy separate speakers for this but it was worth it. It sounds great and it’s working perfectly even after a year.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianna Beharry

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy! I'm disappointed that this is entirely manually operated. You have to lift the arm, guide it to the track and lower it. Once you get to the end of the last track you better run to lift the arm because the needle will push again the paper label and make a racket. I seem to remember my turntables from the 70s were more automated than this one. For 300 dollars I was expecting more.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Z. Schewel

customer_reviews.title: Hardwired RCA cables faulty, rendering player unusable
customer_reviews.text: The player looks great, and mechanically had everything going for it -- sturdy, nice smooth spin. Then I actually plugged in the RCA cables to the speakers. The left output was faulty - crackling alternating between no audio and the audio at about 1/4 of the volume of the right channel. I tried with different speakers, which all work perfectly with other RCA audio sources, and had the same results. Since the cables are hard wired, I've had to return the item. What a shame.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice for Digitizing LPs to Computer
customer_reviews.text: I have digitized over 100 LPs from this turntable to my iMac via the USB interface. I used Audacity to do so and am very, VERY pleased with the results. The sound quality of the resulting AIFF files is excellent - not bassy at all, with good volume levels. This was the sole purpose of my purchasing this turntable, and I couldn't be more pleased with my purchase. Highly recommended...
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: You have to mess with it to fix the sound
customer_reviews.text: After a month of playing just fine, one speaker just sounded terrible. We tried another receiver that we own, but that didn't fix the issue. Tried the unit with different sets of speakers that we know worked just fine and that didn't fix the sound. We swapped out the stylus for a new one with no improvement. The fix for it was to power the unit off, take the cartridge out of the tone arm and push on the 4 connectors inside the tone arm with a non-conductive pointy tool (we used a plastic tipped dart) several times and then reconnect the cartridge. Now the sound is perfect again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SKIP FREE GAME CHANGER
customer_reviews.text: I have owned some 'quality' turntables in the past... so I thought. I am finding it hard to believe that every 1970's record that I have played on this turntable so far that used to skip (for decades I knew just the spot too) now plays skip free. The crackle pop back ground remains and the way I like it at a non-distracting level. No cleaning needed to prevent skips. RPM speed control is dead on. My 200+ vintage record collection just became more valuable to me.
customer_reviews.author: JBGood

customer_reviews.title: There is no auto shut stop
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this turntable because of the reasonable cost and the awesome reviews. After setting it all up, we realized there was no auto stop. Only assumed there was one and never heard of a turntable not having auto stop. Apparently researching turntables, you either choose USB or auto stop. I really did want the USB but having auto stop is more important to me. Anyway, love the sound. Love the looks, Love everything else about it but no auto stop, thus 3 stars. I am unfortunately returning this and buying the similar turntable with an auto stop. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sher

customer_reviews.title: I think I am turning Japanese  lol
customer_reviews.text: Love this turntable. With it being direct driver it's easy to clean records with my discwasher which is mandatory if you plan to play your records without slips. There is some rumble, but barely noticeable only close up, but not through speakers. Getting a good mat should solve some of this. I am sure if you spent $1000 + more can have better specs. Japanese products ROCK!!
customer_reviews.author: THECOFFEEMAN

customer_reviews.title: So Retro
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit looking for a turntable to play some of my old LP's- plus my kids were buying me albums even though I had no turntable! This unit, after some simple setup, really fits the bill. Does the music sound better than a CD? Glad you asked. Sometimes I think it does! I wish the unit was smart enough to seat itself at the end of an album, but getting up and moving the arm is pretty easy stuff at the end of a record. I am satisfied and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jerol Fanta

customer_reviews.title: Nice player
customer_reviews.text: I really like this player. It sounds so much better than my old one. But the one thing I really wished that it had is the ability to return and shut off at the end of a record. Somehow I didnt realize that it could not do that. Everything else is fantastic. I would rate 5 stars if it had that. Fall asleep or walk away and forget to stop the record and it will run until you do...
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic player. My records that sound bad on other ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic player. My records that sound bad on other tables sound amazing on this one. It looks fantastic and it works great as well. I do wish that the RCA cables weren't hardwired to the table, but that can be fixed with one trip to Radio Shack and a hour or so to mod it. It comes with two adapters. One RCA to 3.5mm male and one RCA to 3.5mm female. These can be used normally or plugged together to make an RCA coupler. Since the turntable has hardwired RCA cables, these adapters come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Caige Spade

customer_reviews.title: Defective Start / Stop switch
customer_reviews.text: I must be one of the unlucky buyers. This turntable has great reviews and seems to be well built, but after only a few uses the Start / Start switch which turns the platter motor on and off has failed. But, happy to say that they did return my call and their Tech Rep was a very nice guy..... a new switch will be shipped out at no charge. Apparently its just one of those things, anyway I'm able to work well with my hands so I'll back listening to Lp's soon.
customer_reviews.author: GraflexTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews and love this purchase
customer_reviews.text: What's old is new again. My daughter is a freshman in college and loves records . Last year I bought her a cheap record player to make sure it wasn't just a phase she was going through. Well she played that thing non stop with its horrible sound. So this year I got her this with some nice speakers and we all jammed out together listing to Vinyl. Brought back some awesome old memory's. Get it its awesome. Great quality
customer_reviews.author: wd lash

customer_reviews.title: Nice turntable
customer_reviews.text: This Audio Technica turntable is a great looking turntable that plays vinyl very well. It replaces a Pioneer turntable that I bought in 1972! Lots of features and a good quality cartridge. Best bang for the buck for sure. I'm having a little issue with the anti-skate control but I'm confident that I can fix it with a little time and patience.
customer_reviews.author: beezer

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Nice Look, Nice Mechanical Features
customer_reviews.text: Crisp clean sound from this unit. Connects well with Edifier speakers that were ordered separately. This unit does not have Bluetooth to speakers option but the audio cables work just fine. The needle arm does not return automatically like they did in the old days. What a surprise! But one nice feature is that there is a lever that allows the needle to make contact on the album gently to allow smooth damage free and scratch free placement of the needle on the vinyl record. Provides great sound for a great price. My son LOVE’s listening to his vinyl (Analog) music verses digital music better. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Binning

customer_reviews.title: Left channel static defect
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and was traveling for a bit before I could open the box to set it up. When I finally did, discovered it had the static defect others have described. Left channel sound is horribly static. Unfortunately because I was traveling I'm outside Amazons return window. Update: Contacted Audio-Technica support and they had me do a few checks. They then mailed out a new cartridge for free thinking it was the cause. They were correct. Player sounds great now, and their support folks were great to work with. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: iammillerman

customer_reviews.title: Best sound for money
customer_reviews.text: It took several months of reading reviews, and blogs to finally settle on this turntable. I'm not an audiophile by any means, but I appreciate good quality. I've had a few cheaper turntables before, and i can say that this one was work the little extra money. This turntable was very easy to set up. follow the simple instructions and you're done! The setup is easily adjustable, and the cartridge can be swapped out if you desire so. Great set and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Freytag

customer_reviews.title: It was fine once I fixed it
customer_reviews.text: It was fine once I fixed it, but I had to open it up and connect the start/stop button. The needle also came bent as hell, so I had to replace it. I would suggest buying one of these locally so it's not a huge pain to return. However after a few hours of fixing it's exactly the mediocre turn table I already have one of. If you are just starting to spin with vinyl this is a great choice, easy on the wallet and a standard middle of the road piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement when my old, 30 years worth, turntable died, and have used it to convert my LPs to MP3s. It has performed flawlessly, right out of the box, as I would expect, given the price. It lacks auto-return at the end of the record, but that's OK with me, since that feature makes use of complicated mechanical connections that can go wrong. Hope I can get another 30 years out of this turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Cuningham

customer_reviews.title: I really like this turntable
customer_reviews.text: I really like this turntable, but the plate is not true. There is a very noticeable wobble as the plate rotates and I have read that this has happened to a number of other customers. Other than the quality of the plate machining I am very happy with the turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas DriscollTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Features and Functions
customer_reviews.text: This model has a great array of features and functions. Truly, a swiss army knife for vinyl-heads and audiophiles. Convert your vintage vinyl to digital audio (great to preserve extinct or endangered albums). Stock stylus sounds great to me through the studio reference speakers i use. Has some DJ features, but who cares about that.
customer_reviews.author: Trinnk

customer_reviews.title: We love our Way Back Machine
customer_reviews.text: We love this thing. I call it the way back machine. Having so much fun buying new and used vinyl. We knew nothing about turn tables, so we looked at a couple of “ten best” lists and this one was at the top of both. It was priced right for us so we took the leap, and we are not disappointed! Simple to operate, sounds great, and now our receiver and speakers are getting a second chance at fulfilling their lives’ purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Yinyogini

customer_reviews.title: along with several albums that a friend of his told me he'd enjoy. So far he is very happy with the ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my son, along with several albums that a friend of his told me he'd enjoy. So far he is very happy with the gift - something he would not have splurged upon for himself. I read the product reviews before purchasing this and I'm glad I did. In another review of the product protection plan, I mentioned that I don't think that protection plans should be offered with purchases of products like this. The company that produces products should stand by them for normal wear and tear and repair or replacement, if necessary, without an extended warrantee that is purchased aside from the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Bancroft

customer_reviews.title: Great turntable
customer_reviews.text: so i have been eyeing this for some time. First I'm a DJ for about 20 years I use technics sl1200 mk2 for recording my mixes/podcasts and I bought the Audio Technica. It's a clone while its not exactly the Tech 1200 the Tech 1200 is built a bit sturdier. the Audio Technica is a recommended buy whether you spin Hip Hop, EDM or like to sound of music via vinyl. it's tuff to beat at this price point. See photos
customer_reviews.author: DJ Hector J

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mid-level turntable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this table for 4 years and it still works great. I had the small plastic piece that holds the control arm locked break a few months back. It has gotten lots of use over the past four years. I think it's easy enough to replace but I haven't contacted AT about it yet. I'd recommend this turntable to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: SJP

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good. Build quality is good
customer_reviews.text: Speed is accurate.Sound is good. Build quality is good. I did not like that the Line connectors were hard wired. I did not like that there was no auto return at end of record. To be fair, I knew this going in. I thought I could live with it, I can, but that is why I don't love this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Knuckles

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this turntable! I balked at shelling out the money for it . . . then I remembered the many complaints from friends who complained that cheap stuff they purchased "broke" or "gave out after a year" etc. etc. Easy set-up and great on-line instruction videos made this a piece of cake. Unless you're DJing at a local dance club or music hot spot - this is perfect for the home. IMHO this is quality stuff and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Willis

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, permanent rca cables. Kind of the important part.
customer_reviews.text: Came with a short in the left (permanently attached) RCA cable. Not sure what my warranty options are but didn't did agnose the reason I always had to jiggle the wires to get the left speaker to play...but...now I know and it's long after Amazon's return period. Worth mailing to Ohio? Drop it in the trash? Solder in some new ones? Any recommendations?
customer_reviews.author: 8b63vI4aSp88ZVq32a2qFs3wOutHO6

customer_reviews.title: Break out your Vinyl!
customer_reviews.text: This is great little turntable, especially for the price. Definitely an upgrade from the cheaper ION and Crosley models and worth the extra scratch if you can afford it. Nice smooth action, vari-speed, fine tuning, and light for DJ's. This turntable was designed as a clone/copy of the classic Technics SL-1200, and, although there will be some that will argue this, it pretty much delivers. It sure beats the $1000+ price tag that some original Technics fetch used. I did a lot of research when buying this, and I'm very happy that I decided on this one. There's nothing in this price range that even comes close.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great turntable, solidly built.
customer_reviews.text: Great turntable, solidly built. This is an excellent turntable, in contrast to what is so readily available these days - at least on that's affordable. It's perfect for my needs, especially in the 78 RPM realm. I have no issues with this turntable, and the black looks extremely nice. I bought this as a secondary turntable to hook up to my computer to record my 78's, and the black matches the PC perfectly. A great turntable that does what the more expensive one's do, but this one is affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Chiappette

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful addition
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised to how heavy the table was, but after seeing the quality I understood why. The sound is magnificent and easy to set up. I watch a video on line and found it very helpful..
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Gerena

customer_reviews.title: Soooooooo good!
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, this thing is pretty incredible. You MUST watch the video provided by Audio-Technica. The instruction manual just doesn't explain the balancing of the arm as well. Get ready to love all of the crackles and pops. Sooooo good!
customer_reviews.author: itsGREGSWORLD

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing. High quality
customer_reviews.text: I am former night club disc jockey from the 70's & 80's. I worked in some really big clubs, including the 2001 Clubs of America, from the Saturday Night Fever movie. I always used Technique 1200's. They are/were the Cadillac of the business. Nothing else would do. You can still find the 1200's, but they can go as much as $2000.00. This product is amazing. High quality. Heavy, sturdy and a tough direct drive!
customer_reviews.author: Suzie Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great Entry-Level Machine
customer_reviews.text: Not perfect by any means, but is absolutely a great entry-level machine. You can spend more for "entry-level" according to audiophile blogs, but if you don't have $1,000 to spend on your first turntable give this one a try. The platter is warped, but doesn't effect play at all. The needle is good, but if you want to spring for a better one, you can get them for around $30-$75. Assembly is very easy. Don't forget to calibrate that tone arm though. That's crucial to getting sound out of any turntable. The only thing that absolutely drives me crazy is the insanely short AV cables. That was just the dumbest move ever, Audio-Technica!
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat it for the money with this level of versatility.
customer_reviews.text: Although, you will need to buy an additional head shell and cartridge to play 78, (which the turntable already has a built in holder for), the turn table is a great entry into vinyl. Some may never need anything more. 33, 45, and 78. Can be run to your computer, a phono preamp, or direct through line out straight out of the box. I do lot think it could be beat for the money. The only draw back, and it took 5 min. to fix, is that the cartridge wasn't optimally aligned. So, FYI - align the cartridge first thing with a cartridge alignment tool and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: SDMonkey

customer_reviews.title: It looked great. Went to play a record and discovered that ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. Spent the morning carefully assembling the turntable. It looked great. Went to play a record and discovered that left speaker sound was badly distorted. Spent more time trouble shooting to verify it was set up correctly. I had to return for a refund. No exchange option available. .
customer_reviews.author: James T. Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Good quality higher end turntable but comes with a low quality cartridge.  Replace cartridge and you are good for a long time.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. All of the sound quality of the higher end turntable. Would be nice if it were semi-automatic but tracking and control is spot on. The cartridge that comes with it is a DJ cartridge which doesn't produce as much quality in your sound as a higher end unit. Buy another cartridge to install and you have as good as it gets for way above average listening.
customer_reviews.author: markeby

customer_reviews.title: This turntable does not have automatic lift-off when one LP side is over.
customer_reviews.text: My LPs, played on this set, have areas where the sound is mushy and crackly. At first I thought that I had allowed the LPs to become dusty or dirty. But I have always handled them by the edges, and never left them lying around. This is now happening with everything I play. That and the set not having automatic lift-off, so that if I don't jump out of my chair fast enough, the needle starts running on the label, makes me not want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: gregory smith

customer_reviews.title: Truly awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is truly the best turn table I have ever owned. It's high tech and puts out the best, warmest sound I have ever heard. I mean this thing is fancy and beautiful. I paired it with an aftermarket mat and cork board and I get zero static! If you are interested in vinyl this is a player you should not pass up.
customer_reviews.author: Victor D. Stuckey

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job, and more - with a minor caveat...
customer_reviews.text: Broke out the vinyl from storage, and wanted to replace my 30-40 year old Scott PS89. I want to enjoy my LPs as well as be able to rip them to i-Tunes, and the new table supports that requirement. The only negative is that this is not a fully automatic turntable, my first. Meaning that at the end of the record, the listener must make the move to end the session. This is the only negative I have found so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Bee

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Received the turntable and spent 20 minutes unboxing and putting it together only to find that the platter wobbles like crazy, the cantilever on the stylus was bent, the anti-skate is useless and the sound is subpar. For this price, this should’ve been so much better. The best part of this experience is sending it back for a refund. Do yourself a favor and avoid this overpriced hunk of junk and spend your money on a better unit.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Nuckolls

customer_reviews.title: Super impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up in a record store and have had some very expensive hi-fi equipment throughout the years. I bought this as a temporary turntable for enjoying my record collection after I moved to Hawaii from the mainland, and I am not going to have to upgrade to anything more expensive. Great turntable!
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: This is a very impressive turntable. Has a built-in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very impressive turntable. Has a built-in pre-amp if needed but can be switched off if not needed. Only knock would that the arm does not auto return but since this is a professional unit I could see why a DJ may not want that to happen. This unit is well made and was surprised how heavy it was.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great buy... but... it's the little things
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this right up until the lock for the tone arm snapped off. Very cheap plastic. otherwise, the setup was easy and the sound is amazing. First album played was Aqualung... I'm in love with LP's again. Teamed up with my Oppo 203 and my Yamaha 681... great system. For speakers, I went with some Polk bookshelf. Again... good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. O. Gross

customer_reviews.title: A gift of a lifetime
customer_reviews.text: Amazon came through big time when they had the "same day shipping" on this item. My girlfriend wanted one for Christmas and I ordered it on the 23rd and it came in the same day, so big plus in my book. I told her not to look at the box thinking it would show the description of what it is but to my surprise the labeling just said "from amazon fulfillment" so I had nothing to worry about. The build quality of this bad boy is top notch and the sound brings you back to classic sound of vinyl. So if you're looking one and have the money to buy a good solid one I will highly recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding value. Arrived on time and was well packaged. Turntable was easy to set up, instructions were easy to follow. Hooked system up through my surround sound system,sounds great. My only complaint was when it came to adjusting tone arm tracking force. Instructions said to refer to the manufactures specification for recommended tracking force. Unfortunately the cartridge was packed in a clear bag with no weight stamped anywhere. Watched a video on you tube on how to set up turntable by audio- technical and it provided the recommended tracking weight for supplied cartridge. After setting up as recommended by the video turntable worked flawless.
customer_reviews.author: trinity51

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic beginner turntable
customer_reviews.text: This is the first turntable I've ever bought and I think it's great for beginner's! I love the sound quality and have used it most nights to listen to before I go to bed. It's easy to use and is really high quality parts. The only thing i wishit had was a auto stop function once our got to the end of a record though that's a lot to be appoint of a $180 turntable
customer_reviews.author: Justin S.

customer_reviews.title: Plays well, beware shipping damage
customer_reviews.text: Works like a dream. Dust cover arrived with a major crack, but I unwrapped the dust cover last so it was all put together before I noticed. Sucks. I don't think that's covered in the warranty, so I'm probably out more money. It's a hassle to take it all apart and return the whole thing for one piece of plastic, so I guess it is what it is. Still, actual turntable is sleek and plays perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: A great turntable for the price
customer_reviews.text: A great turntable for the price! Sturdy, and hefty, this thing is mostly metal. I've had mine for about a year now, but it's still going strong. The latch to keep the arm from moving broke when my fiance tried to move the arm without realizing it was latched in, but a little super glue fixed that. The sound quality is pretty great, and all the additional features (adjustable speed, 3 speeds, reverse and the miniature light for setting the needle more accurately) are all fantastic. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: some user

product_meta.title: Audio-Technica AT-LP120-USB Direct-Drive Professional Turntable (USB & Analog), Silver
product_meta.description:
Color:SILVERAudio-Technica's AT-LP120-USB direct-drive, high-torque professional turntable is perfect for DJs and other music enthusiasts, especially in an era that many would call "postvinyl," when it's no longer the norm for audio/video receivers or even integrated amplifiers to offer a dedicated phono input. Connect the Audio Technica ATLP120 to your computer to digitize your old LPs (laptop not included). It also includes a selectable internal stereo phono preamplifier and a USB output that connects directly to your computer-perfect for digitizing your old LPs to high-quality MP3 or FLAC files for playback from your computer. USB cable and adapter cables are included, along with Mac- and PC-compatible Audacity software to digitize your LPs. The AT-LP120's S-shaped tone arm assembly comes with an adjustable counterweight, an antiskate adjustment, a tone-arm height adjustment and lock, a tone-arm lift with hydraulic action and lift lever, and a tone-arm rest with a locking mechanism to keep the arm stable during transport. The turntable uses a DC servo motor to maintain accurate rotational speed at either 33-1/3 45, or 78 rpm, governed by a selectable, high-accuracy quartz-controlled pitch lock-all of which gives new life to 7- and 12-inch singles you may not have played for years. Unleash your inner DJ with the 'table's pitch-adjustment feature, with variations ranging from either +/-10 percent or +/-20 percent. A pop-up stylus target light and stroboscopic platter speed indicator offer visual assistance in queuing and playing your favorite tunes. Forward and reverse play options unlock countless creative doors. The turntable comes with a cast-aluminum record platter, a slip mat, and a professional cartridge and headshell (model AT95E) that plugs directly into the tone arm. Adjustable, antivibrational feet keep the platter level, regardless of your environs. A start/stop button with remote start/stop input lets you integrate the player with your more sophisticated DJ tools. The player also includes a 45 rpm adapter with storage receptacle for the adapter and for a surplus or replacement headshell (sold separately). If the turntable is connected to a sound card, powered speakers or AUX -type inputs, set the selector to LINE, which will activate the turntable’s internal pre-amp 



The half-inch standard mount AT95E phonograph cartridge offers outstanding clarity and detail. Reviewers have rated this affordable, high-performance cartridge as a best buy value. Manufactured to Audio-Technica's renowned quality standards, each cartridge is meticulously assembled with remarkably tight tolerances. The elliptical diamond stylus is designed to track record grooves with high accuracy for outstanding audio reproduction. Includes mounting hardware and stylus guard.



SPECIFICATIONS:

Frequency Response: 20-20,000 Hz

Channel Separation: >20 dB at 1 kHz

Tracking Force Range: 1.5-2.5 grams 2.0 grams (20 mN) recommended tracking force

Recommended Load Impedance: 47,000 ohms Output 3.5 mV (1 kHz, 5 cm/sec)

Channel Balance: within 2.0 dB

Stylus Type: 0.4 x 0.7 mil elliptical diamond stylus

Cantilever: Alloy tube

Mount: Half-inch
feature_bullets: dual RCA (female) to 3.5 mm (1/8") mini-plug (male) stereo adapter cable
dual RCA (female) to 3.5 mm (1/8") mini-plug (female) stereo adapter cable

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,655 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
